comment: Never checked his emails, yet expected us to communicate.

I struggled with this class in the beginning because of the software, but after talking with Professor Dunham he was able to help me understand better and my grade improved tremendously. He is very kind and understanding, so don't be afraid to ask for help. Each week there's a lab and discussion. Just try and you will pass.

Great professor; makes sure that everyone is up to speed every step along the way. Be ready to put in a little time for this course because assignments might take a while if you aren't familiar with editing software. Really felt like I knew what I was doing by the end, though!
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Online Savvy

comment: I'm actually taking this class right now. I've never had a more empathetic, available professor! There are two students that were blowing up our group chat, they just posted negative reviews in the last day and they refuse to take the advice Ian is offering, such as following along with tutorial videos and implementing his recommendations.

Just started podcasting and I can't wait! We're going to create an entire season by the end of the term. Professor is prompt in responses and is understanding about technology challenges. Discord is great, and we use it primarily for class.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Online Savvy

comment: I'm a graduating senior, and I'd have to say that Professor Dunham was one of the best instructors I've had at KSU, even though I'm not going to pursue podcasting in my career, the audio editing skills he taught are really useful. He also got us to think more deeply about the societal role of podcasts, which I appreciate.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Professor Dunham spent the first day of class going over the D2L shell and the syllabus in a LOT of detail. He also got back to me within 30 minutes whenever I emailed him about an assignment. The assignments all have D2L rubrics that clearly lay out expectations, and I was always graded incredibly fairly. HIGHLY RECOMMEND!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Accessible outside class--Online Savvy

comment: I have been at KSU for 3 years now and this is by far the most unfair, disrespectful, and harsh professor I have come in contact with. Professor Dunham's course is unorganized, unclear in instructions, and confusing. It even came to the point where I had to reach out to the head of the MENT department. 0/10 would recommend.

My experience was marred by disorganization and unpredictability. The delayed grading of assignments, excessive reliance on pop quizzes, and constantly changing syllabus created a chaotic learning environment.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Beware of pop quizzes--Online Savvy

comment: My second time taking Professor Dunham and would take him again if I wasn't graduating. He has a passion for what he teaches and will answer any questions. He plans when his assignments are due around busy semesters (no big projects due finals week, etc.). Overall, a great professor who takes an interest in what his students are interested in.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Online Savvy

comment: We talked about a lot of subjects related to music, the class was mostly conversation-based covered culture, history, and technology. Grades are fair, although there are quizzes over the readings occasionally.
My only issue was the lack of communication/ time between answering his discord messages. He also waits a while to get his grades in for the semester. Not bad but not great.

Ian's podcasting class was fun and enlightening. He runs through the basics of using Audition and general theory on podcasting, and you build the framework for your own season. I only wish we could have produced the whole thing during the semester, that would have been a better thing to leave class with.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class--Online Savvy

comment: Finishing up podcasting, Professor Dunham keeps things simple. Audio quality matters! Making good content matters too. He presents content on Discord and gets back to me quickly when I have a question about an assignment. He's constantly bringing in outside examples of good podcasts, and encourages us to use Discord to interact with each other.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class--Online Savvy

comment: I was excited to take podcasting since I expected it to be different than my other classes. Overall he is very nice, but his work is excessive and just honestly a bunch of busy work when we are not working on podcast episodes. I understand it is considered a upper level class, but the majority of the work is just plain all busy work.

It's important that students have some experience in Adobe Audition before taking this course. I had no previous experience and that caused a lot of stress. Professor Dunham does go over some of the basics but there is only so much he can cover in an hour. You will most likely have to rely on YouTube tutorials to complete assignments.

Prof Dunham is hands down the best prof I've ever had. I've taken him for two separate courses and am hoping to take him again in my last semester at KSU. Easily the most accessible to reach professor, usually responding almost instantly. He's extremely helpful and allows you to edit your work when necessary. He sets his students up for success.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Professor Dunham is pretty solid regarding his podcasting class. Attendance isn't mandatory, but he gives extra points for attending. Class sessions are short, so just get the points. Adobe Audition is what he uses and it's pretty helpful in the editing world. If you do the work and turn it in on time you'll get an A, simply put. Take him!

Take professor Ian if you actually want to learn something and not just have grades given out to you. Class can be difficult if you are not a tech person but the professor always uploads the class materials. I saw the other reviews saying he doesn't reply back to questions but the professor always replies back before the end of the due date.

Professor Dunham is constantly on Discord answering our questions. This class has a lot of technical challenges if you've never used audio software before, so that's a major hurdle to get over. However, he will explain concepts over video chat or on a YouTube tutorial if a student asks. I would totally take him again for another class!

I am taking Profesor Dunham online this summer. Dunham has not updated any of the modules past June, it is currently July 4th. Dunham is quick to hand out "0"'s and does not offer help explaining. Dunham holds class each week at random times. These classes are not mandatory but there is a lot of pressure to attend. DO NOT TAKE!

Professor Dunham is a great professor. He responds INSTANTLY to the discord and posts detailed videos describing exactly how to do each lab. Hes very helpful and I would definitely take his class again.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria

comment: This isn't an easy class, especially for a non-techie like me. He posts tutorial videos, though, that walk through exactly how to accomplish the tasks in the labs he assigns.

Many complain that hes hard to reach, but as stated in the syllabus, Ive had no issues contacting Professor Dunham through discord. The labs can be challenging at first, which is a given when learning how to use a new software, but the weekly videos are normally very detailed, and any missing info is situation-specific and can easily be googled.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Participation matters

comment: I didn't know anything about production before this class, or very little at least. We've went through the basic of audio, video, and photo. I feel pretty comfortable in Audition, Premiere Pro, and Photoshop now.

A class that should have been fun and entertaining was riddled with lack of communication and response from the professor with very unclear instructions for his labs for some users. He does not care to reach back out to his students when they're in dire need of assistance and it's simply a red flag as a professor to not be willing to help students

The class itself is interesting and sounded like it would be a lot of fun to learn digital media consisting of video editing and music clip edits and more, however, if you have PC, he does not go in depth on how to use pc for his labs. When trying to communicate with him on his discord (only place he ever answers) he ignored our whole class

The class consists of weekly labs that go through Photoshop, Premiere, and Audition. Professor Dunham is awesome! Communication is all on Discord, and he responds right away (even on weekends). I wish all professors had this level of communication with online classes.

instructions were never clear- many students struggled with the format of assignments even halfway through the semester. modules weren't posted on time, usually several days later. doesn't respond to emails and takes days to respond on discord. only plus was having the entire semester to correct labs, but it took forever to get grades

I'm sure he's probably a decent professor but I dont think he should be allowed to teach online. I struggled with one simple thing that I sent numerous emails about with screenshots and details asking for help. He ended up giving me zeros for my homework assignments despite the fact that I did them, and even asked for help. He never once responded

Professor Dunham was easily my favorite professor this semester. He truly cares about his students and their success. If you show up to class and engage you will get an A. Highly recommend taking his class, hes a great person!

If you have the chance to take Professor Duncan, he is absolutely amazing. Literally all you have to do is show up to class, stay engaged with him and your classmates, care about your work and you will pass. Discussion posts almost every week, summaries are an easy A as long as you participate and talk with him and others in class. TAKE HIM!
Take him for this class!!!! You definitely have to take the time to do all the assignments but he isn't that hard of a grader as long as you follow the instructions. He's so cool loved this class

Professor is extremely diligent about taking care of his students. Lectures are interesting and pertinent to subject matter. Final project instead of a final. I will DEFINITELY be looking for this professor again.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Participation matters

comment: Great professor. Super chill. Really helps you understand and is fair on grading. Participation matters but it is worth it to help you understand.

Professor Dunham was awesome! During COVID-19, I was nervous about taking such a rigorous class online. He was quick to reply to any of my emails with my concerns and his grading is clear and precise. I would definitely take a class with him again.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria

comment: We worked through several pieces of the Adobe suite, like Premiere and Photoshop. It was good to get some basic familiarity with these tools. I feel like it was a lot of work, but then again, summer courses always feel that way.

Prof Dunham has been really engaging so far this semester. We meet weekly on Discord, which is great since I was already using it. His lectures are short, and the assignment requirements are always clear.

Professor Dunham is awesome! He always got back to me promptly either through email or GroupMe, and was always clear about what was going to be on a test. The class was pretty writing intensive, but he was also clear about his expectations for those assignments. He's interested in making sure students succeed, and I'd happily take another course.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Inspirational--Clear grading criteria

comment: I had Professor Dunham this past summer for Global Media Systems. He uses academic papers as weekly texts. They were usually around 15-20 pages long. You have to complete 7 of 14 possible weekly summaries. He also provides Powerpoints for each of the readings, and often does lectures on the same readings. He gives good feedback on the summaries.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--Tough grader

comment: This was my second time taking Prof. Dunham. I will not take him again. He does not require a textbook but instead assigns weekly readings that you are quizzed over and must write summaries on. This wouldn't be difficult if the readings weren't 40+ pages of scholarly text that is not understandable to the student. Test are terrible. He is terrible.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: Just ended the semester, and can honestly say this class was the best of the fall by a long shot. Mr. Dunham engages with class nearly every session, and tries to make it discussion oriented. He has a lot of interesting things to say about media and the internet.

We cover a different topic weekly. He chooses interesting readings that correspond to that topic. No textbook, so that's a plus. Very interesting stuff we discuss, he tries to be as interactive as he can.

The textbook wasn't so necessary, but does help if I'm confused about something. The teaching makes things easy to understand, and the grading is pretty easy. This subject is nothing I'm that excited by, but professor Dunham keeps things as entertaining as they can be.
Probably my favorite instructor this semester. Pros: easy assignments, lively discussion. Cons: sometimes a bit abstract, not always the most relevant to me personally. He's always energetic, though!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy

comment: Professor Dunham is great! I really appreciate the effort he puts into making material accessible. As long as you take the weekly quizzes, you're doing okay.

He grades easy, but criteria for projects is never clear. It seems like he doesn't really know the material that he is teaching very well-he stumbles over his words the whole lecture and never even finishes making the powerpoint presentations. He also changed his attendance policy halfway through the semester. Don't feel like I've learned anything.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: He was fine at the beginning of the semester, not strict attendance, said he did not care if we came or not. Halfway through the semester, he changed his attendance policy so now it is required.

The class has no exams, midterm, or final, just weekly short quizzes and smaller projects. However, the class itself is very boring and has very little student engagement. It seems as if the professor himself isn't entirely sure of what he is teaching. Although it is boring, it is not a difficult class at all.
His class was interesting and fun. Even better no exams, midterms or finals. There are projects and he takes attendance but the class is enjoyable so it is not bad to go anyway.
